main event: An ANG pilot flying an F-86A observed a white flash or glow near his aircraft while at 40,000 feet over Joliet, Illinois, on October 31, 1957.
interesting points: The pilot observed the white flash for approximately 30 minutes before it disappeared., The pilot was unable to establish radio contact with the object., The sighting took place at night under clear conditions., The object's brightness was compared to that of an automobile headlight in the report., No unusual phenomena were found during the investigation following the report.
sighted object: white flash or glow near the left wing
witness description: ANG pilot flying an F-86A at 40,000 ft
